subject: Climate & Environment
title: The US Clean Air Act
description: A fast breakdown of The US Clean Air Act for builders.

hook.text: In 1970, rivers were catching fire and smog choked American cities. Congress acted fast.

buildup.text: The Clean Air Act set national limits on six key pollutants and created the EPA to enforce them.

discovery.text: Since 1970, the six major pollutants dropped 78% â€” while the US economy grew 285%.

twist.text: The law's benefits outweigh its costs by an estimated 30 to 1 ratio.

climax.text: It prevented an estimated 230,000 early deaths per year by 2020.

punchline.text: The best investment America ever made was cleaning the air.

quiz.question: By how much did the six major pollutants drop since the Clean Air Act?
